answers.answer: My pregnancy started out the same as yours and I was diagnosed with high blood pressure at 14 weeks, baby also is suffering from iugr (intrauterine growth restriction diagnosed @ 24wks). My swelling depends on how active I have been and slight swelling at the end of the day is a normal pregnancy system. I have been on modified bed rest since 27 weeks and now 32 weeks and still neg for preeclampsia. Rest as much as possible, my dr told me if it is not essential to sustain a normal lifestyle then do not do it (ie sweeping, mopping, shopping, etc). Drink lots of water and make sure you are eating a healthy diet. I wish you the best of luck!
Preeclampsia is generally seen also w swellin.g in the face. But real swelling. Good luck.

I have a friend who has five kids she noticed my swelling and thinks i may have preclampsia.she had it w all five and was induced with all excpet one. She told me if I wake one morning and feel weird she said go to my dr or hospital. She said I would know. Jus thought I would share...also they put me on meds for my blood pressure at 28 weeks. So im afraid I may be induced soon. Good luck.
Thanks for ur feedback ladies im going to the docs this afternoon this is my first pregnancy so im not sure whats the norm and whats not! Better to be safe than sorry. X

I swelled up huge in the ankles, wrists and face and lying down, sitting or standing made no difference. Then I was seeing white spots so bad I could hardly see anything else. This was dead giveaway to my OB that it was PE supposedly. Good luck and fingers crossed it improves for you!

question: Hi ladies, im currently 17 weeks pregnant and was diagnosed with high blood pressure a month ago after going to the doctors with severe migraines that lasted for 3 weeks! I had no swelling or protein in my urine when I was last tested but have just noticed swelling in my ankles last night its not alot but I have been having these occasional headaches aldo. My questions is for any one who's had pre eclampsia how much swelling did you get? I know you generally dont get pre eclampsia until after week 20 onwards but im just concerned because I already have pregnancy induced high blood pressure.
title: Pre eclampsia?
